javadoc:
A collection of utility methods that prevent you from having to do unsafe casts of {@link Collection} classes due to runtime type erasure.

Be sure to check Guava and Apache collection utils before using this class, as they are standard utilities and often more efficient.

Some examples:

  1. {@link Iterators}
  2. {@link Iterables}
  3. {@link org.apache.commons.collections4.CollectionUtils}
  4. {@link IterableUtils}
  5. {@link IteratorUtils}
  6. {@link Maps}
  7. {@link Sets}
  8. {@link StringUtils#join(Iterable, char)} - for pretty printing collections with newlines
  9. Apache CollectionUtils.collect(Collection, Transformer) - to turn a collection in to collection of strings when the default toString() is lacking

methods.name: asSet
methods.comment:
Turns the given items into a set.  If there is only a single item and it is null, then
 an empty set will be returned.

params.name: items
params.comment: the items to put in the set

methods.name: asSet
methods.comment: Drains the given iterator into a new Set

methods.name: asSet
methods.comment:
Turns the given iterable into a new Set, returning it directly if it is a set, draining
 it into a set if it is not already.

methods.name: asList
methods.comment:
Similar to Arrays#asList(Object...), except that this method will turn a single
 null parameter into an empty list.  Also, this method creates a new, mutable array, 
 whereas the former's array is not mutable.

params.name: items
params.comment: the items to add to the list

methods.name: asList
methods.comment:
Returns the given list if not null, otherwise returns an empty list. This is
 useful for clients avoid null checks.

methods.name: asList
methods.comment:
A convenient way to check for null and whether the given collection is a List.
 If the value is a list, then it is returned.  If the value is null, an empty list is
 returned.  Otherwise, a new list is created from the given collection.

methods.name: nonNull
methods.comment:
Returns the given collection if not null, an empty collection (a Set) otherwise.  This is
 useful for clients avoid null checks.

methods.name: asCollection
methods.comment:
Returns the given collection if not null, an empty collection otherwise.  This is
 useful for clients avoid null checks.

methods.name: asList
methods.comment:
Checks that the elements in the given list are of the type specified by clazz
 and then casts the list to be of the specified type.

return.comment: a casted list of type T

methods.name: asCollection
methods.comment:
Checks that the elements in the given collection are of the type specified by
 clazz and then casts the collection to be of the specified type.

return.comment: a casted list of type T

methods.name: isAllSameType
methods.comment: Returns true if each item in the list is of type clazz.

return.comment: true if each item in the list is of type clazz

methods.name: isOneOf
methods.comment: Returns true if the given item is in the collection of possible items

return.comment: true if the given item is in the collection of possible items

methods.name: isAllNull
methods.comment:
Returns true if all the given objects are null.

 See also apache ObjectUtils#anyNotNull(Object...) and
 ObjectUtils#allNotNull(Object...)

return.comment: true if all the given objects are null

methods.name: isAllNull
methods.comment:
Returns true if all the given objects are null.

 See also apache ObjectUtils#anyNotNull(Object...) and
 ObjectUtils#allNotNull(Object...)

return.comment: true if all the given objects are null

methods.name: isBlank
methods.comment: Returns true if the given array is null or has 0 length

methods.name: isBlank
methods.comment: Returns true if the given array is null or has 0 length

methods.name: asIterable
methods.comment: Turns the given item into an iterable

params.name: t
params.comment: the object from which to create an iterable

return.comment: an iterable over the given iterator

methods.name: asIterable
methods.comment: Returns an iterable over an iterator

params.name: iterator
params.comment: the iterator to create an iterable from

return.comment: an iterable over the given iterator

methods.name: asIterable
methods.comment:
Combines all collections passed-in, using Iterables, into a pass-through 
 (not creating a new collection) Iterable.
 
 This is just a convenience method for Iterables#concat(Iterable)

methods.name: asStream
methods.comment: Turns the given iterator into a stream

methods.name: asStream
methods.comment:
Combines all iterables passed-in, using Iterables, into a pass-through 
 (not creating a new collection) Stream.

methods.name: any
methods.comment:
Returns an element from the given collection; null if the collection is null or empty.
 This is meant for clients that have a collection with any number of items and just need
 to get one.

methods.name: any
methods.comment:
Returns an element from the given iterable; null if the iterable is null or empty.
 This is meant for clients that have a collection with any number of items and just need
 to get one.

name: CollectionUtils
comment:
A collection of utility methods that prevent you from having to do unsafe casts of
 Collection classes due to runtime type erasure.
 
 Be sure to check Guava and Apache collection utils before using this class, as they are 
 standard utilities and often more efficient.
 
 Some examples:
 
 	Iterators
  Iterables
  org.apache.commons.collections4.CollectionUtils
  IterableUtils
  IteratorUtils
  Maps
  Sets
  StringUtils#join(Iterable, char) - for pretty printing collections with newlines
  Apache CollectionUtils.collect(Collection, Transformer) - to turn a 
      collection in to collection of strings when the default toString() is lacking
